19 namespace pses_kinect_utilities

22 void MedianFilterNodelet::onInit()
23 {
24  NODELET_DEBUG("Initializing median filter nodelet...");
25 
26  ros::NodeHandle& private_nh = getPrivateNodeHandle();
27  ros::NodeHandle& nh = getNodeHandle();
28 
29  // Init dynamic reconfigure
30  reconfigureServer =
31  boost::make_shared<dynamic_reconfigure::Server<MedianFilterConfig>>(
32  private_nh);
33  dynamic_reconfigure::Server<MedianFilterConfig>::CallbackType f;
34  f = boost::bind(&MedianFilterNodelet::dynReconfCb, this, _1, _2);
35  reconfigureServer->setCallback(f);
36 
37  current_frame_.reset(new sensor_msgs::Image);
38  it_.reset(new image_transport::ImageTransport(nh));
39 
40  // Read parameters
41  private_nh.param("queue_size", queue_size_, 1);
42 
43  // Monitor whether anyone is subscribed to the output image or to its camera
44  // info
45  image_transport::SubscriberStatusCallback connect_cb =
46  boost::bind(&MedianFilterNodelet::connectCb, this);
47  ros::SubscriberStatusCallback connect_info_cb =
48  boost::bind(&MedianFilterNodelet::connectCb, this);
49  // Make sure we don't enter connectCb() between advertising and assigning to
50  boost::lock_guard<boost::mutex> lock(connect_mutex_);
51  pub_filtered_image_ = it_->advertiseCamera(
52  "image_out", 1, connect_cb, connect_cb, connect_info_cb, connect_info_cb);
53 }
54 
55 void MedianFilterNodelet::connectCb()
56 {
57  boost::lock_guard<boost::mutex> lock(connect_mutex_);
58  if (pub_filtered_image_.getNumSubscribers() == 0)
59  {
60  NODELET_INFO("Stopping median filter...");
61  sub_depth_.shutdown();
62  }
63  else if (!sub_depth_)
64  {
65  NODELET_INFO("Running median filter...");
66  image_transport::TransportHints hints("raw", ros::TransportHints(),
67  getPrivateNodeHandle());
68  sub_depth_ = it_->subscribeCamera(
69  "image_in", queue_size_, &MedianFilterNodelet::depthCb, this, hints);
70  }
71 }
72 
73 void MedianFilterNodelet::depthCb(
74  const sensor_msgs::ImageConstPtr& depth_msg,
75  const sensor_msgs::CameraInfoConstPtr& info_msg)
76 {
77  cv_bridge::CvImagePtr cv_ptr;
78  sensor_msgs::CameraInfo cam_info = *info_msg;
79  uint8_t kernel_size = config_.kernel_size;
80 
81  try
82  {
83  cv_ptr = cv_bridge::toCvCopy(*depth_msg, depth_msg->encoding);
84  }
85  catch (cv_bridge::Exception& e)
86  {
87  NODELET_ERROR("cv_bridge exception: %s", e.what());
88  }
89 
90  if (cv_ptr->image.depth() > CV_8U && config_.kernel_size > 5)
91  {
92  kernel_size = 5;
93  NODELET_WARN("INVALID KERNEL SIZE: You can only use a maximum kernel size "
94  "of 5 for the median filter when using images encoded with "
95  "more than 8 bits pro pixel. Using kernel size 5 instead...");
96  }
97 
98  // Check if opencl is available
99  if (cv::ocl::haveOpenCL())
100  {
101  // Apply a median filter using the OpenCL libraries of OpenCV
102  cv::medianBlur(cv_ptr->image.getUMat(cv::ACCESS_READ),
103  cv_ptr->image.getUMat(cv::ACCESS_WRITE), kernel_size);
104  }
105 
106  else // CPU variant
107  {
108  // Apply a median filter using OpenCV
109  cv::medianBlur(cv_ptr->image, cv_ptr->image, kernel_size);
110  }
111 
112  // Convert the data back to a ROS Image and store it in procImg
113  cv_bridge::CvImage cvi;
114  cvi.header = depth_msg->header;
115  cvi.encoding = depth_msg->encoding;
116  cvi.image = cv_ptr->image;
117  cvi.toImageMsg(*current_frame_);
118 
119  pub_filtered_image_.publish(*current_frame_, cam_info, ros::Time::now());
120 }
121 
122 void MedianFilterNodelet::dynReconfCb(MedianFilterConfig& inputConfig,
123  uint32_t level)
124 {
125  config_ = inputConfig;
126  // Check if the kernel size is even
127  if (config_.kernel_size % 2 == 0)
128  config_.kernel_size += 1; // Enforce an odd kernel size.
129  NODELET_INFO_STREAM("Reconfigured median filter params");
130 }
131 
132 } // namespace pses_kinect_utilities
